name: DadDeckâ„¢ - White Dad Trading Card Simulator
description: Satirical trading card pack-opening simulator parodying suburban American dad culture through collectible cards.

userStories.title: Landing Page - Hero Section
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see an engaging hero section that explains what DadDeck is, so I can quickly understand the value proposition.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays catchy headline about dad stereotypes
Primary CTA button 'Open Pack' routes to pack opener
Secondary CTA 'Learn More' scrolls to features section
Background features subtle floating card animation
Mobile responsive (stacks vertical on small screens)
Animation performs at 60fps on mid-tier devices

userStories.title: Landing Page - Features Section
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see key features highlighted, so I can understand what makes DadDeck unique.
acceptanceCriteria: 4 feature cards displayed: 'Free Pack Opening', '50+ Unique Cards', 'Share Your Pulls', 'No Microtransactions'
Each card has an icon, title, and description
Grid layout: 1 col mobile, 2 col tablet, 4 col desktop

userStories.title: Landing Page - Featured Cards Showcase
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see sample cards with different rarities, so I can understand the card system before opening packs.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards use actual Card.svelte component for consistency
Hover effects: card tilt and glow

userStories.title: Landing Page - Pack Preview Animation
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see an animated pack preview, so I can get excited about opening packs.

userStories.title: Landing Page - Footer
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want footer navigation, so I can find additional information and legal links.
acceptanceCriteria: Links: About, Privacy, Terms (placeholder pages for now)

userStories.title: Pack Opening - Pack Tear Animation
userStories.description: As a player, I want a satisfying pack tear animation, so the pack opening feels premium and exciting.
acceptanceCriteria: Sound effect placeholder (comment where audio goes)

userStories.title: Pack Opening - Staggered Card Reveal
userStories.description: As a player, I want cards to reveal one-by-one, so I can anticipate and appreciate each card pull.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards flip individually with 0.3s delay between each
3D flip animation using CSS transform: rotateY
Rarity-specific reveal effects (more particles for rarer cards)

userStories.title: Pack Opening - Results Screen
userStories.description: As a player, I want to see all revealed cards in a results view, so I can review my pull and decide what to do next.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards sorted by rarity (mythic first, common last)
Layout optimized for mobile and desktop

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Idle State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have an idle state, so the system knows when a user is ready to open a pack.
acceptanceCriteria: Open Pack button triggers state transition
Loading spinners not shown in idle state

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Generating State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have a generating state, so the UI can show loading feedback during pack creation.
acceptanceCriteria: State transitions to 'generating' when pack creation starts

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Pack Animate State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have a pack_animate state, so the tear animation plays before revealing cards.
acceptanceCriteria: UI shows animation, no cards yet
State transitions to 'cards_ready' when animation completes

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Cards Ready State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have a cards_ready state, so the system knows cards are ready for reveal.
acceptanceCriteria: State transitions to 'cards_ready' after pack animation
Cards generated but not yet displayed

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Revealing State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have a revealing state, so cards flip one-by-one.
acceptanceCriteria: State transitions to 'revealing' when cards start flipping
State transitions to 'results' when all cards revealed

userStories.title: Pack State Machine - Results State
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack state machine to have a results state, so users can review their pull.
acceptanceCriteria: State transitions to 'results' when reveal complete
All cards displayed in grid view
State persists until user initiates new pack

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Card Image Generation
userStories.description: As a player, I want to generate shareable images of my cards, so I can post them on social media.
acceptanceCriteria: Uses Canvas API or html2canvas library
Renders card as high-res PNG (2x for retina displays)
Includes card artwork, stats, name, rarity indicator

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Pack Pull Collage
userStories.description: As a player, I want to generate a collage of all cards in my pack, so I can share my entire pull.
acceptanceCriteria: Creates grid layout of all 6-7 cards

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Twitter Integration
userStories.description: As a player, I want to share my pulls to Twitter, so I can show off my cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Function: shareToTwitter(text: string, imageUrl: string) opens Twitter intent
Default text: 'Just pulled [Card Name] in DadDeck! ðŸŽ´ #DadDeck'

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Discord Integration
userStories.description: As a player, I want to share my pulls to Discord, so I can show my friends.
acceptanceCriteria: Function: shareToDiscord(imageUrl: string) copies image to clipboard
Fallback: downloads image if clipboard API unavailable

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Download Image
userStories.description: As a player, I want to download card images, so I can save my pulls locally.
acceptanceCriteria: Function: downloadImage(imageUrl: string, filename: string) triggers download

userStories.title: Social Sharing - Share Modal
userStories.description: As a player, I want a share modal dialog, so I can choose how to share my pull.
acceptanceCriteria: Modal opens on 'Share This Pull' button click
Close button (X) and ESC key support

userStories.title: Collection - LocalStorage Persistence
userStories.description: As a player, I want my opened packs saved to browser storage, so I can view my collection later.
acceptanceCriteria: Pack data saved to LocalStorage on open
Stores: pack ID, timestamp, cards array

userStories.title: Collection - State Management
userStories.description: As a developer, I want collection state managed in Nanostores, so components can react to changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Store type: CollectionState with openedPacks, uniqueCards, totalCards, rarityCounts
Action: savePackToCollection(pack: Pack) adds to collection

userStories.title: Collection - Gallery View
userStories.description: As a player, I want to view all my collected cards in a gallery, so I can see what I've pulled.
acceptanceCriteria: Grid view of all owned cards
Responsive: 2 col mobile, 4 col tablet, 6 col desktop
Cards display artwork, name, rarity indicator
Scrollable with infinite loading if large collection

userStories.title: Collection - Filter by Rarity
userStories.description: As a player, I want to filter my collection by rarity, so I can find specific cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Filter buttons: All, Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, Mythic
Buttons use rarity colors from RARITY_CONFIG
Gallery updates reactively on filter change
Filter state persisted in URL query params

userStories.title: Collection - Filter by Type
userStories.description: As a player, I want to filter my collection by dad type, so I can see all BBQ Dads, etc.
acceptanceCriteria: Dropdown or button group for dad types
16 type options: BBQ_DAD, FIX_IT_DAD, GOLF_DAD, etc.
Supports multi-select (view multiple types at once)

userStories.title: Collection - Search by Name
userStories.description: As a player, I want to search my collection by card name, so I can find specific cards.

userStories.title: Collection - Sort Options
userStories.description: As a player, I want to sort my collection, so I can view cards in different orders.
acceptanceCriteria: Sort dropdown: Rarity (desc), Name (asc), Date Obtained (desc)

userStories.title: Collection - Stats Header
userStories.description: As a player, I want to see my collection stats, so I know how many cards I own.
acceptanceCriteria: Header displays: 'You own X unique cards from Y packs'
Stats update reactively on collection change

userStories.title: Collection - Export/Import
userStories.description: As a player, I want to export my collection, so I can back it up or share it.
acceptanceCriteria: Validation on import (check format, required fields)
Merge or replace options on import

userStories.title: Collection - Clear Collection
userStories.description: As a player, I want to clear my collection, so I can start fresh.
acceptanceCriteria: Clear button in settings or collection page
Confirmation dialog: 'Are you sure? This cannot be undone.'

userStories.title: Routing - Collection Page
userStories.description: As a player, I want to access my collection via a dedicated route, so I can bookmark it.
acceptanceCriteria: Link from landing page ('My Collection' button in nav)

userStories.title: Routing - Navigation Component
userStories.description: As a player, I want navigation links, so I can move between pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Nav component with: Logo, Home, Collection links
Mobile hamburger menu for small screens

userStories.title: Card Component - Stats Visualization
userStories.description: As a player, I want to see card stats visually, so I can quickly understand a card's strengths.
acceptanceCriteria: 8 stat bars: Dad Joke, Grill Skill, Fix-It, Nap Power, Remote Control, Thermostat, Sock & Sandal, Beer Snob
Each bar shows 0-100 value with color gradient
Bar length proportional to stat value
High stats (80+) highlighted with glow effect

userStories.title: Card Component - Holographic Effects
userStories.description: As a player, I want holographic cards to have special effects, so they feel premium.
acceptanceCriteria: Holo variants: standard, reverse, full_art, prismatic
Sparkle particle animation based on rarity

userStories.title: Card Component - Rarity Glow
userStories.description: As a player, I want cards to glow based on rarity, so I can quickly identify valuable cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Glow on hover and for rare+ rarities

userStories.title: Pack Generator - Rarity Distribution
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack generator to follow rarity distribution rules, so packs are balanced.
acceptanceCriteria: Slot 4-5: Uncommon or better (20% rare, 5% epic, 1% legendary+)
Slot 6: Rare or better (50% rare, 10% epic, 2% legendary+, 0.1% mythic)

userStories.title: Pack Generator - Card Selection
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the pack generator to select cards randomly from the appropriate pool, so pulls are varied.
acceptanceCriteria: Random selection without replacement within pack
Prevents duplicate cards in same pack (if possible)
Fallback: allow duplicates if pool exhausted

userStories.title: Pack Generator - Holo Variant Assignment
userStories.description: As a developer, I want holo variants assigned randomly, so packs feel exciting.
acceptanceCriteria: Distribution: 80% none, 15% standard, 3% reverse, 1.5% full_art, 0.5% prismatic

userStories.title: Card Database - Populate 50 Cards
userStories.description: As a developer, I want 50 unique cards in the database, so players have variety to collect.
acceptanceCriteria: Rarity distribution: 20 common, 15 uncommon, 8 rare, 4 epic, 2 legendary, 1 mythic
Each card has: id, name, subtitle, type, rarity, stats, flavorText, abilities, series, cardNumber, totalInSeries, artist

userStories.title: Card Database - Card Artwork Placeholders
userStories.description: As a developer, I want placeholder artwork for all cards, so the UI is complete.

userStories.title: Testing - Pack Generation Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for pack generation, so I can verify rarity distribution.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: slot 6 always rare or better
Test: no duplicate cards in same pack (when possible)
Test: all cards valid (required fields present)

userStories.title: Testing - Card Database Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for card data, so I can catch data errors.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: all cards have unique IDs
Test: all types valid (16 dad types or ITEM)
Test: required fields present (name, subtitle, etc.)

userStories.title: Testing - Random Utility Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for random utilities, so I can verify distribution accuracy.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: seeded random produces consistent results
Test: no bias in random selection

userStories.title: Testing - UI State Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for UI state transitions, so I can verify the flow works.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: state reset on new pack

userStories.title: Performance - Initial Load Optimization
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the initial page load to be under 3 seconds, so users don't bounce.

userStories.title: Performance - Animation Optimization
userStories.description: As a developer, I want animations to run at 60fps, so the experience feels smooth.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile with Chrome DevTools Performance tab

userStories.title: Accessibility - Keyboard Navigation
userStories.description: As a keyboard user, I want to navigate the interface without a mouse, so I can use the site.

userStories.title: Accessibility - ARIA Labels
userStories.description: As a screen reader user, I want descriptive ARIA labels, so I can understand the interface.

userStories.title: Mobile Responsiveness - Touch Targets
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want touch targets large enough to tap, so the site is usable.

userStories.title: Deployment - Production Build
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a production build, so I can deploy to Vercel.
